critique: The document pertains to the National Industrial Recovery Act and specifically addresses the regulation of machine hours in the cotton textile industry, particularly concerning tire yarns and fabrics for rubber tires. It extends a previous stay on provisions limiting machine hours until further hearings can be conducted. This suggests government intervention in economic activity. There is no mention of immigration, executive power, federalism, national security, or social inclusion. The document seems to be a moderate intervention in the economy, with no clear ideological tilt.
